# Question

You are given a DataFrame `df_cars` with car data with columns `manufacturer` and `model`. Write a function audi_filter that filters down the dataset to only the rows with manufacturer “audi” and model being “a4 or “a4 quattro”, then it should create a new column `audi_a4_type` that equals `true` across all rows. Then return the resulting DataFrame.

```julia
using DataFrames

function audi_filter(df_cars::DataFrame)
    filter!(row -> (row[:manufacturer] == "audi") && (row[:model] == "a4" || row[:model] == "a4 quattro"), df_cars)
    df_cars[:audi_a4_type] = true
    return df_cars
end
```

This function filters the DataFrame based on the given conditions using `filter!` function from DataFrames package. Then it adds a new column `audi_a4_type` to the DataFrame and sets its value to `true` for every row. Finally, it returns the modified DataFrame.
